column4: i running ubuntu-dapper in a latitude 120l but wireless not show in lspci, any idea?! sorry, my english is bad! :)
does the laptop have a disble/enable wirelless button most have one...
in setup de wireless is on
can you paste 'dmesg' and 'lspci -v' and 'cat /proc/interrupts' to a pastebin?
flaky hardware (drive; cable; power cable) attached to ata3 sata port or maybe a kernel bug
probably a kernel bug because i switch the drive, cable and power cable... motherborad
i switch all hardware to a new core2duo.... and the problem is same
have you tried a different kernel?
and... i have a server with ubuntu 7.10 desktop... and not apresent that problem
for gutsy probably the best option is to dwonload the deb of the hardy kernel from packages.ubuntu.com and install it (if possible never tried i build my own kernels)
u recommend a older version of kernel?
you can try with the edgy kernel too
its probably a kernel bug alright?
i can not know for sure may be bad hardware too as i said but you said you changed all hardware so...
the only way to know for sure is to try another kernel
